channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Man charged with possessing and importing 158 airsoft guns without a licence
item.description:
August 07, 2020 12:20 PM

SINGAPORE - A man was charged on Friday (Aug 7) with possessing and importing 158 airsoft handguns without a licence.

item.title: Actor-singer Aliff Aziz pleads guilty to theft and behaving in disorderly manner in public
item.description:
August 07, 2020 11:10 AM

SINGAPORE - Actor-singer Mohamad Aliff Aziz, 29, pleaded guilty on Friday (Aug 7) to one count each of theft and behaving in a disorderly manner in public.

item.title: ComCare assistance for 6,000 lower-income households automatically extended for 6 more months
item.description:
August 07, 2020 11:04 AM

SINGAPORE - About 6,000 lower-income households whose public financial assistance is ending will now have peace of mind as their support will be automatically extended for another six months.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Aug 7
item.description:
August 07, 2020 8:12 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Friday, Aug 7.

item.title: Public warning system to be sounded twice on Aug 9
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

The public warning system will be sounded twice on National Day, with the second time at 8.20pm, as Singaporeans all over the island get up on their feet to recite the National Pledge.

item.title: Almost all workers in dorms tested for Covid-19 by today
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Almost all of the 323,000 foreign workers staying in dormitories would have been tested for Covid-19 by today, and about 90 per cent of them can go back to work by the end of this month.

item.title: Singapore committed to investing in people: Chan Chun Sing
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Not content with simply meeting the basic requirements for graduation, Mr Daryl Jude Lawrence's passion for medical diagnostic devices prompted him to choose a daunting research project in his final year.

item.title: Bukit Batok gym among places visited by Covid-19 patients
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

An ActiveSG gym in Bukit Batok, a Sheng Siong store in Teban Gardens Road and FairPrice Hub's Decathlon outlet were added by the Ministry of Health (MOH) yesterday to its list of places visited by Covid-19 patients while they were still infectious.

item.title: Students' CCA efforts will still be recognised: MOE
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Co-curricular activities (CCAs) have been forced to take a backseat this year, but students' records will not be unduly penalised, the Ministry of Education (MOE) has said.

item.title: Six-month reprieve to developers 'quite generous': Lawrence Wong
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

A six-month extension in May for the completion of residential, commercial and industrial projects and for developers to sell off housing units was "quite generous", said Education Minister Lawrence Wong.

item.title: HDB resale volume in July highest in two years; prices also up
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

The number of resale transactions of Housing Board (HDB) flats last month hit the highest in two years, even as prices crept up, according to flash data released by real estate portal SRX Property yesterday.

item.title: Steps to better support migrant workers' mental, physical health
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

The authorities are looking into better supporting the mental and physical health needs of migrant workers here in the long run, said the multi-ministry task force tackling Covid-19 yesterday.

item.title: Further remand for three suspects inked to four-year-old girl's murder
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

The trio allegedly linked to the murder of four-year-old Megan Khung Yu Wai will be further remanded for one more week at the Central Police Division after a district judge allowed the prosecution's application for the move yesterday .

item.title: Covid-19 drug from Singapore-based firm to enter final trials soon
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Trials for a potential treatment for Covid-19 are being accelerated, with the third and final phase for the drug due to start in a few weeks' time.

item.title: School conducts CCA sessions at class level
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Secondary 2 student Sofea Carmila Rohaizat was disappointed when her twice-weekly Girl Guides sessions came to a halt in March.

item.title: Singapore cautiously moving towards a new normal amid Covid-19 pandemic
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

S'pore should not let its guard down even though the number of new cases here is likely to taper down by end-August as dorms are cleared.

item.title: Singapore Red Cross to donate $50,000 to assist in relief
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

The Singapore Red Cross will contribute an initial sum of $50,000 towards the emergency response and medical support by the Lebanese Red Cross in the devastating warehouse explosion that killed at least 145 and injured more than 5,000 in Beirut, the organisation said yesterday.

item.title: Look out for red logo - to spot and support local food produce
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

A bright red label on the packaging will help shoppers identify local produce with greater ease from this month onward.

item.title: Coronavirus: Seventh month prayers and post-funeral rites allowed
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

The Health Ministry said they must be conducted by religious organisations with a good track record of implementing safe management measures.

item.title: Aug 9 fireworks to take place at 10 locations islandwide
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

The public will be able to enjoy fireworks displays for National Day at 10 different locations across the island this year.

item.title: 5 Taoist temples nominated to join pilot scheme for higher worship service limit
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

The Taoist Federation has nominated five temples to join a pilot programme that allows for an increase in the attendance limit for congregational and other worship services in places of worship.

item.title: Coronavirus: Shorter SHN for Malaysian work pass holders based on risk assessments
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Malaysians with Singapore work passes will serve a seven-day stay-home notice (SHN) instead of 14 days as Covid-19 prevalence rates in Malaysia are similar to Singapore's, said Health Minister Gan Kim Yong yesterday.

item.title: Homemade treats, workout beats for National Day
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Those looking for National Day-themed desserts, followed by an intense workout to sweat it out, will be spoilt for choice this weekend.

item.title: Retrenched RWS staff mostly foreigners: MOM
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Foreigners bore the brunt of last month's retrenchment exercise at Resorts World Sentosa (RWS), with the integrated resort making efforts to cut costs and management salaries before it laid off workers, said the Ministry of Manpower (MOM) yesterday.

item.title: IPPT for NSmen suspended until Sept 30, waiver for those affected
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Individual physical proficiency tests (IPPT) for operationally ready national servicemen (NSmen) continue to be suspended until Sept 30, said the Ministry of Defence (Mindef) in a mobile phone text message sent to NSmen on Wednesday.

item.title: Follow NDP2020 event with e-guide featuring song lyrics, show synopsis
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

People who cannot attend this year's National Day Parade (NDP) evening show can follow the performances and sing along to the songs with the help of an e-guide released yesterday.

item.title: Locals allowed to travel can tap subsidies for treatment if infected
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

From today, Singaporeans and permanent residents (PRs) who are allowed to travel overseas under permitted arrangements and subsequently develop Covid-19 can tap government subsidies, MediShield Life and Integrated Shield Plans (IPs) for their hospital treatment.

item.title: LTA, JTC and SLA to get new bosses
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

The Land Transport Authority (LTA), JTC Corporation and Singapore Land Authority (SLA) will have new chief executives from next month.

item.title: Default must still be work from home amid Covid-19 pandemic: Lawrence Wong
item.description:
August 07, 2020 5:00 AM

Work-from-home arrangements will continue in order to guard against potential Covid-19 transmission.
